WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
This is a low-priority one but anyhow. The spaces in Javascript are missing after tsc compilation from several language constucts like if (...), for (...) and maybe others as well.

Instead of "if (" and "for ("  the compile emits "if(" and "for("

This contradicts the way formatting has been defined in Javascript (and almost any language having similar structures).  Removing spaces is OK in minification/compression but the spaces should probably be there after compilation.
